instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3476 No power
threads.message:
Hi.

Liquid damaged board, corrosion to U1900 cleaned up and replaced.

No S5 and no S5 enables.
PPBUS = 8.27V

Bad SMC?

threads.title: 820-3476 No power
threads.message: PPBUS is with battery only or charger only or both connected???

threads.title: 820-3476 No power
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 12800"]PPBUS is with battery only or charger only or both connected???[/QUOTE]

Charger only.

I was thinking with no S5 enabes and PPBUS a little low it would be SMC. You thinking somethig else?

threads.title: 820-3476 No power
threads.message: This is not "a little low" it is too low, check ISL area, sense resistors, Voltage on pin 2, seems more like a bad ISL than a bad SMC.......

threads.title: 820-3476 No power
threads.message: 8.27 is too low. Do you have a green and the orange light?

threads.title: 820-3476 No power
threads.message: EDIT: answered but tiered, will check for sure in morning

threads.title: 820-3476 No power
threads.message: Green only, one wire 3V3 no communication

threads.title: 820-3476 No power
threads.message: Looks like SMC issue. SMC_RESET high? 3V42 checked?

threads.title: 820-3476 No power
threads.message:
I ran it through the Crest UC which I think cleared some crap from the trackpad connector.

Machine working. Thanks for your helps guys
